newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile shares end softer on power sector jitters.
newsitem.headline: Chile shares end softer on power sector jitters.

text.p: Chilean blue chips limped to a weak close as gloom continued over the spat between the government and power companies over new electricity rates.
The bolsa is expected to resume its downward drift at the opening with the spotlight remaining on electricity stocks, which account for 40 percent of the weighted IPSA index.
"The market is being moved solely by news from the electricity sector," said one trader.
The IPSA index ended unofficially down 0.38 percent at 100.15 points. The general IGPA index shed 0.48 percent to 5,457.72 points.
Volume shrank to around seven billion pesos from 9.2 billion pesos Monday.
The light turnover reflected the apathetic mood of the market with investors disillusioned by the dispute over electricity prices which has undermined stocks for two sessions in a row, said dealers.

Leading decliners included power investment company Enersis on fears the firm will suffer a double hit as generation and distribution prices are both set to fall sharply in the government's review, said traders.
Enersis, which controls generator Endesa and distributor Chilectra, lost 0.9 percent to 246-1/2 pesos. Endesa shed 0.68 percent to 257 pesos.
Investors will also be looking to see whether the government succeeds in negotiations to find a strategic partner to buy a 37.5 percent stake in power utility Colbun, said traders.
State board Corfo has set Wednesday as the deadline for agreeing a deal with a Chilean/Belgian group which was the only consortium to bid for the utility last week.
The government originally spurned the offer as too low, but later backpedalled, saying it would enter talks with the group.
Winners included pulp producer Copec, up 0.56 percent at 1,790 pesos, fertilizer producer Soquimich, up 0.41 percent at 2,425 pesos, and telecom Entel which rose 0.26 percent to 3,860 pesos.
